analyzed: lus dben par 'jug pa dang / sems yid du 'ong bar 'jug pa dang / chad pa ma yin par 'jug pa dang / rtag pa ma yin par 'jug pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen la 'jug pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pa dang /
translated: It is to engage in the body being empty. It is to engage in the mind being pleasant. It is to engage in the absence of annihilation. It is to engage in the absence of permanence. It is to engage in causes and conditions. It is to engage in dependent origination.

original: sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa la 'jug pa dang / ma 'ongs ma phyin mi gnas pa la 'jug pa dang / mi 'pho ba dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu chud mi za ba dang / rgyu stong pa nyid du rnam par @313b 'byed pa la 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa la 'jug pa dang / ma 'ongs ma phyin mi gnas pa la 'jug pa dang / mi 'pho ba dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu chud mi za ba dang / rgyu stong pa nyid du rnam par @313b 'byed pa la 'jug pa dang /
translated: It is to engage in the absence of sentient beings, the absence of life force, and the absence of personhood. It is to engage in the absence of coming, going, and abiding. It is to engage in the absence of transference and the absence of the loss of cause and effect. It is to engage in the analysis of the emptiness of causes.

original: mtshan ma med pa 'dris par bya ba la 'jug pa dang / smon pa med pa rab tu shes pa la 'jug kyang stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa len par 'jug pa ma yin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa len pa la 'jug kyang ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis skye ba la mi 'jug pa dang /

translated: It is to engage in becoming familiar with the absence of attributes, and to engage in understanding the absence of wishes. It is to not engage in adopting emptiness and the absence of wishes, and to engage in adopting meditative stability and meditative absorption. It is to not engage in taking rebirth due to the power of meditative stability.

original: mngon par shes pa'i ye shes len pa la 'jug kyang zag pa zad pa la mi 'jug pa dang / mi skye bar rtog pa la 'jug kyang nges par gyur par 'gro ba la mi 'jug pa dang / sems can thams cad bdag med par rtog par 'jug kyang snying rje chen po gtong ba la mi 'jug pa dang /

translated: It is to engage in adopting the wisdom of the higher perceptions, and to not engage in the exhaustion of defilements. It is to engage in the realization of nonarising, and to not engage in the attainment of certainty. It is to engage in the realization that all beings are selfless, and to not engage in abandoning great compassion.

original: skye ba thams cad 'jigs par mthong ba la 'jug kyang srid pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa len pa la 'jug pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa la 'jug kyang chos mngon du bya ba la mi 'jug pa dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi dga' ba dang /

original: ji ltar sems can bdag med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad ni /🔽bdag med par mthong ste /🔽de ltar mthong na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems can bdag med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad ni / bdag med par mthong ste / de ltar mthong na /
translated: Just as the self is unborn and does not cease, so all phenomena are unborn and do not cease.

original: tshul bzhin du mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du mthong ngo //
translated: Just as the self is purified, so all phenomena are purified.🔽Just as the self is not defiled, so all phenomena are not defiled.🔽Just as the self is not fettered and is not liberated, so all phenomena are not fettered and are not liberated.🔽Just as the self is not something that can be apprehended, so all phenomena are not something that can be apprehended.🔽Just as the self is not something that can be demonstrated, so all phenomena are not something that can be demonstrated.🔽Just as the self is not something that can be observed, so all phenomena are not something that can be observed.🔽Just as the self is not something that can be attained, so all phenomena are not something that can be attained.🔽Just as the self is not something that can be realized, so all phenomena are not something that can be realized.

original: gang tshul bzhin 'khor ba'i khams mthong ba de tshul bzhin mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams dang ldan par mthong ste /
analyzed: gang tshul bzhin 'khor ba'i khams mthong ba de tshul bzhin mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams dang ldan par mthong ste /
translated: Just as the self is not something that can be purified, so all phenomena are not something that can be purified.🔽Just as the self is not something that can be produced, so all phenomena are not something that can be produced.🔽Just as the self is not something that can be destroyed, so all phenomena are not something that can be destroyed.🔽Just as the self is not something that can be increased, so all phenomena are not something that can be increased.🔽Just as the self is not something that can be diminished, so all phenomena are not something that can be diminished.🔽Just as the self is not something that can be augmented, so all phenomena are not something that can be augmented.🔽Just as the self is not something that can be diminished, so all phenomena are not something that can be diminished.🔽Just as the self is not something that can be augmented, so all phenomena are not something that can be augmented.🔽Just as the self is not something that can be increased, so all phenomena are not something that can be increased.

original: de ni / tshul bzhin du sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / tshul bzhin du sbyor ba zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' kun rdzob kyi bden pa 'chad pas mi skyo //

original: don dam pa'i bden pa mngon du byed par mi ltung /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa mngon du byed par mi ltung /

analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi bden pa mtshan nyid med pas rtogs par byed pa de ni /

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattvas’ expertise in the truths.

original: gzhan yang bden pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang bden pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the truths are

original: gcig pu / gnyis ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gcig pu / gnyis ma yin pa ste /
translated: one, not two.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //

original: de la bden pa gcig pu la gang sgro mi 'dogs pa dang / sems can sgro 'dogs par lhung ba rnams la bden pa sbyor bar byed pa de ni /
analyzed: de la bden pa gcig pu la gang sgro mi 'dogs pa dang / sems can sgro 'dogs par lhung ba rnams la bden pa sbyor bar byed pa de ni /
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattvas do not superimpose anything on the one truth, and they apply the truth to beings who have fallen into superimposition.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattvas’ expertise in the truths.

original: gzhan yang phung po lnga rnams ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang phung po lnga rnams ni /
translated: Moreover, the five aggregates are

analyzed: sdug @320b bsngal ba ste /

original: gang phung po lnga rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid de ni /
analyzed: gang phung po lnga rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid de ni /

analyzed: gang phung po rnams kyi bag la nyal rgyu sred pa las byung ba'i lta ba de ni /

analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'o //

original: gang sred pa'i rgyu lta ba de la yang sgro mi 'dogs /
analyzed: gang sred pa'i rgyu lta ba de la yang sgro mi 'dogs /
translated: The view that is the cause of craving is not exaggerated,

original: mi len / mi snyems pa de ni /
analyzed: mi len / mi snyems pa de ni /

original: kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the noble truth of the origin.🔽The cessation of the five aggregates is due to their complete exhaustion.

original: gang phung po lnga rnam shin tu zad pa'i phyir 'gog pa sngon gyi mthar ma byung ba /
analyzed: gang phung po lnga rnam shin tu zad pa'i phyir 'gog pa sngon gyi mthar ma byung ba /
translated: It does not come from the past,

original: phyi ma'i mthar mi 'pho ba /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mthar mi 'pho ba /
translated: it does not go to the future,

original: da ltar byung bar mi gnas pa de ni /
analyzed: da ltar byung bar mi gnas pa de ni /

original: 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the noble truth of cessation.

original: gang lam la brten nas sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa la yang reg par byed la /
analyzed: gang lam la brten nas sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa la yang reg par byed la /
translated: The path is based on the path. It is the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of the origin, and the knowledge of cessation.

original: rjes las rtogs pa'i shes pa yang thob par byed pa de ni /
analyzed: rjes las rtogs pa'i shes pa yang thob par byed pa de ni /

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that is called the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: gang bden pa shes pa de la rnam par rtog pa dang / sems can yongs su brtag pa la rtog par byed pa de ni /
analyzed: gang bden pa shes pa de la rnam par rtog pa dang / sems can yongs su brtag pa la rtog par byed pa de ni /
translated: When one who knows the truths thinks about the conceptualization of sentient beings,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that is called the bodhisattva’s expertise with the truths.

original: gzhan yang tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba ste /

original: de la tshor bar bya ba rnam par 'byed pa dang / blos rig pa nyid de ni /
analyzed: de la tshor bar bya ba rnam par 'byed pa dang / blos rig pa nyid de ni /
translated: The discernment of what is to be felt and the awareness of that by the mind,

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that is called the noble truth of suffering.

original: rgyu gang gis kun 'byung bar @321a *//
analyzed: rgyu gang gis kun 'byung bar @321a *//
translated: The cause by which there is origination,

original: shes pa'i rgyu de ji lta ba yang dag par rab tu shes ba de ni /
analyzed: shes pa'i rgyu de ji lta ba yang dag par rab tu shes ba de ni /
translated: and the correct understanding of that cause just as it is,

original: kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that is called the noble truth of origination.

original: gang tshor ba gtong zhing ma tshor ba tshor bar byed pa dang / 'gog pa la yang so sor rtog la tshor ba 'gog pa yang mngon du mi byed pa de ni /
analyzed: gang tshor ba gtong zhing ma tshor ba tshor bar byed pa dang / 'gog pa la yang so sor rtog la tshor ba 'gog pa yang mngon du mi byed pa de ni /
translated: When one does not feel, but feels what is not felt, and when one discerns cessation, but does not actualize the cessation of feeling,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the bodhisattva’s noble truth of the cessation of suffering.

original: tshor ba gang gis gzings dang 'dra ba'i lam de sdud par byed la tshor bar dgos pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba gang gis gzings dang 'dra ba'i lam de sdud par byed la tshor bar dgos pa yang ma yin /
translated: When one gathers the path that is like a raft through feeling, but feeling is not a necessity,

original: lam gyi dgos pa yang ma yin pa de ni /
analyzed: lam gyi dgos pa yang ma yin pa de ni /
translated: and the path is not a necessity,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the bodhisattva’s noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: de ltar rtogs nas bden pa de bzhi la mnyam par mthong zhing mthong ba shin tu dag pa'ang ma yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs nas bden pa de bzhi la mnyam par mthong zhing mthong ba shin tu dag pa'ang ma yin pa de ni /
translated: Having realized this, when one sees these four truths as equal, but one’s vision is not completely pure,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the bodhisattva’s expertise in the truths.

original: gzhan yang skye ba sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang skye ba sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: “Moreover, birth is suffering.

original: gang mi skye ba la so sor rtog par shes pa de ni /
analyzed: gang mi skye ba la so sor rtog par shes pa de ni /
translated: When one understands the discernment of what is unborn,

original: sdug bsngal shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the knowledge of suffering.

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba ste /
translated: The condition of existence is birth.

original: gang srid pa 'jig par shes pa de ni /
analyzed: gang srid pa 'jig par shes pa de ni /
translated: The knowledge of the destruction of existence is

original: kun 'byung ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: called the knowledge of the origin.

original: skye ba thams cad gang gis mi skye bar shes pa de la 'gog pa gang yang med cing /
analyzed: skye ba thams cad gang gis mi skye bar shes pa de la 'gog pa gang yang med cing /
translated: The knowledge of the non-production of all births is the knowledge of the cessation of all births.

original: gang mi 'gog par shes pa de ni /
analyzed: gang mi 'gog par shes pa de ni /
translated: The knowledge of the non-cessation of anything is

original: zad pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zad pa 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: called the knowledge of the cessation of extinction.

original: gang de ltar tshor ba dang / 'jal ba dang / yongs su tshor ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / 'jug pa'i shes @321b pa de ni /
analyzed: gang de ltar tshor ba dang / 'jal ba dang / yongs su tshor ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / 'jug pa'i shes @321b pa de ni /
translated: The knowledge of the experience, the measurement, the complete experience, the conceptualization, and the engagement of feelings is

original: lam shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lam shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: called the knowledge of the path.

original: gang bden pa'i shes pa de la gzhog par byed kyang bden pa'i shes pa de la mi gnas pa de ni /
analyzed: gang bden pa'i shes pa de la gzhog par byed kyang bden pa'i shes pa de la mi gnas pa de ni /
translated: The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the non-abiding in the truth.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa ste /
translated: That is the bodhisattva’s knowledge of the truth.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In that way,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: the bodhisattva who practices the perfection of wisdom has the knowledge of the truth.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is a bodhisattva’s skill in the analytical knowledges?

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni /
translated: There are four:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa ste /🔽bzhi gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa ste / bzhi gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: the bodhisattvas’ analytical knowledge of the meaning,🔽the bodhisattvas’ analytical knowledge of phenomena,🔽the bodhisattvas’ analytical knowledge of clear expression,

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshigs so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshigs so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: and the bodhisattvas’ analytical knowledge of ready speech.

original: de la don so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la don so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ analytical knowledge of the meaning?

original: gang chos rnams la don dam pa'i tshig tu shes pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i rgyu shes pa dang / rkyen shes pa dang / 'dus pa shes pa dang / mtha' med pa'i rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / brten pa la 'jug pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: gang chos rnams la don dam pa'i tshig tu shes pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i rgyu shes pa dang / rkyen shes pa dang / 'dus pa shes pa dang / mtha' med pa'i rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / brten pa la 'jug pa shes pa dang /
translated: It is the knowledge of the ultimate word for phenomena, the knowledge of nonduality, the knowledge of causes, the knowledge of conditions, the knowledge of the collection, the knowledge of the endless, the knowledge of the engagement of dependence,

original: chos kyi dbyings dbyer med par shes pa dang / de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa shes pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' mi gnas pa shes pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang / mtshan ma med pa rtogs pa shes pa dang /🔽smon pa med pa la smon pa med par shes pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa la mngon par 'du byed par shes pa dang / tshul gcig tu 'jug @322a *//
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dbyer med par shes pa dang / de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa shes pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' mi gnas pa shes pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang / mtshan ma med pa rtogs pa shes pa dang / smon pa med pa la smon pa med par shes pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa la mngon par 'du byed par shes pa dang / tshul gcig tu 'jug @322a *//
translated: It is to know the indivisibility of the realm of phenomena. It is to know to follow suchness. It is to know the nonabiding of the limit of reality. It is to know the realization of emptiness. It is to know the realization of signlessness.🔽It is to know the absence of wishes in the absence of wishes. It is to know the nonconditioning of conditioning. It is to know the engagement in a single way.

original: pa shes pa dang / sems can med bar 'jug pa shes pa dang / bdag med par 'jug pa shes pa dang / srog med pa byed pa gcig pa shes pa dang / gang zag med pa don dam par shes pa dang / 'das pa'i dus la ma chags par shes pa dang /
analyzed: pa shes pa dang / sems can med bar 'jug pa shes pa dang / bdag med par 'jug pa shes pa dang / srog med pa byed pa gcig pa shes pa dang / gang zag med pa don dam par shes pa dang / 'das pa'i dus la ma chags par shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know the engagement in the absence of sentient beings. It is to know the engagement in the absence of a self. It is to know the absence of life and the single activity. It is to know the absence of persons as ultimate. It is to know the past without attachment.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la mtha' med par shes pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la thams cad du shes pa dang / phung po rnams la sgyu mar shes pa dang / khams rnams la sbrul gdug pa dang mtshungs par shes pa dang / skye mched rnams la stong pa nyid du nges par rtog pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la mtha' med par shes pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la thams cad du shes pa dang / phung po rnams la sgyu mar shes pa dang / khams rnams la sbrul gdug pa dang mtshungs par shes pa dang / skye mched rnams la stong pa nyid du nges par rtog pa shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know that the future is endless. It is to know the present in all its aspects. It is to know the aggregates to be illusory. It is to know the elements to be like poisonous snakes. It is to know the sense sources to be empty.

original: nang zhi ba shes pa dang / phyi rol tu mi rgyu ba shes pa dang / yul la yul med par shes pa dang / dran pa la gnas su shes pa dang / rtogs pa la khong du chud par shes pa dang / blo gros la mngon sum du shes pa dang /
analyzed: nang zhi ba shes pa dang / phyi rol tu mi rgyu ba shes pa dang / yul la yul med par shes pa dang / dran pa la gnas su shes pa dang / rtogs pa la khong du chud par shes pa dang / blo gros la mngon sum du shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know the inner to be at peace. It is to know the outer to be unmoving. It is to know objects to be devoid of objects. It is to know mindfulness to be a state of being. It is to know realization to be a state of understanding. It is to know intelligence to be direct perception.

original: bden pa la rab tu rtogs par shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la mi 'byung bar shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba la mngon par 'du mi byed par shes pa dang / 'gog pa la mtshan nyid med par shes pa dang / lam la sgrol bar shes pa dang /
analyzed: bden pa la rab tu rtogs par shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la mi 'byung bar shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba la mngon par 'du mi byed par shes pa dang / 'gog pa la mtshan nyid med par shes pa dang / lam la sgrol bar shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know the truth. It is to know suffering as non-arising. It is to know the origin of suffering as non-conditioning. It is to know cessation as having no characteristics. It is to know the path as liberation.

original: chos la tshig rab tu tha dad par shes pa dang / dbang po rnams la 'jug par shes pa dang / stobs rnams la mi rdzi bar shes pa dang / zhi gnas la gnas su shes pa dang / lhag mthong la snang bar shes pa dang /
analyzed: chos la tshig rab tu tha dad par shes pa dang / dbang po rnams la 'jug par shes pa dang / stobs rnams la mi rdzi bar shes pa dang / zhi gnas la gnas su shes pa dang / lhag mthong la snang bar shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know phenomena as having distinct words. It is to know the faculties as engaging. It is to know the powers as invincible. It is to know stability as tranquility. It is to know illumination as vipaśyanā.

original: sgyu ma la sgrub par shes pa dang / smig rgyu la 'khrul par @322b shes pa dang / rmi lam la mi bden pa mthong bar shes pa dang / brag cag la rkyen la 'jug par shes pa dang / mig yor la 'pho bar shes pa dang /
analyzed: sgyu ma la sgrub par shes pa dang / smig rgyu la 'khrul par @322b shes pa dang / rmi lam la mi bden pa mthong bar shes pa dang / brag cag la rkyen la 'jug par shes pa dang / mig yor la 'pho bar shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know illusions as accomplishments. It is to know mirages as confusion. It is to know dreams as seeing what is untrue. It is to know echoes as engaging conditions. It is to know optical illusions as transformations.

original: mtshan nyid sna tshogs la mtshan nyid gcig tu shes pa dang / 'du ba la 'bral bar shes pa dang / rab tu sbyangs pa la phyir mtshams sbyor ba med par shes pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la sgra'i rjes su 'gro bar 'jug pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid sna tshogs la mtshan nyid gcig tu shes pa dang / 'du ba la 'bral bar shes pa dang / rab tu sbyangs pa la phyir mtshams sbyor ba med par shes pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la sgra'i rjes su 'gro bar 'jug pa shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know the single characteristic of the various characteristics. It is to know separation in relation to union. It is to know the absence of reconnection in relation to thorough training. It is to know how to engage in the vehicle of the hearers by following the words.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la brten pa la 'jug pa shes shing dben pa la mchog tu shes pa dang / theg pa chen po la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs bsags pa thams cad shes pa ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la brten pa la 'jug pa shes shing dben pa la mchog tu shes pa dang / theg pa chen po la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs bsags pa thams cad shes pa ste /
translated: It is to know how to engage in the vehicle of the solitary buddhas and to know that solitude is supreme. It is to know the accumulation of all the roots of virtue in the Great Vehicle.

original: de ni / byang chub sems dpa'i don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / byang chub sems dpa'i don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisatvas’ correct understanding of the meaning.

original: gzhan yang don so so yang dag par rig pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang don so so yang dag par rig pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the correct understanding of the meaning

original: gang don la rton pa ste /
analyzed: gang don la rton pa ste /
translated: is to rely on the meaning.

original: chos thams cad kyi chos nyid kun gyi don la rton pa nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi chos nyid kun gyi don la rton pa nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: It is to follow the meaning of the nature of all phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: chos thams cad ma lus par stong pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma lus par stong pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are empty without exception.

original: stong pa'i don gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: stong pa'i don gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The meaning of emptiness🔽is the meaning of the Dharma.

original: don no // chos thams cad ma lus par mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: don no // chos thams cad ma lus par mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are signless.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i don gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i don gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The meaning of signlessness🔽is the meaning of the Dharma.

original: don no // chos thams cad ma lus par smon pa med pa ste /
analyzed: don no // chos thams cad ma lus par smon pa med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are wishless.

original: smon pa med pa'i don gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i don gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The meaning of wishlessness🔽is the meaning of the Dharma.

original: don no // chos thams cad ma lus pa rnam par phye ba ste /
analyzed: don no // chos thams cad ma lus pa rnam par phye ba ste /
translated: All phenomena are without discrimination.

original: rnam par phye ba'i don gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rnam par phye ba'i don gang yin pa de ni /

translated: the practice of compassion, the cultivation of all roots of virtue, the confession of one’s own and others’ evil deeds, the rejoicing in the merit of all sentient beings of the three times, the request to the buddhas to turn the wheel of the Dharma, the request to the bodhisattvas not to pass into nirvāṇa, the dedication of one’s roots of virtue to the attainment of unsurpassed and perfect awakening, and the constant practice of the recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the Dharma, the recollection of the Saṅgha, the recollection of morality, the recollection of giving, and the recollection of the deities.

original: rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / sems dang po bskyed pa rnams dang / spyod pa la zhugs pa @330b rnams dang / phyir mi ldog pa rnams dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / sems dang po bskyed pa rnams dang / spyod pa la zhugs pa @330b rnams dang / phyir mi ldog pa rnams dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang /
translated: the bodhisattvas who have attained patience, the bodhisattvas who have attained the irreversible level, and the bodhisattvas who are impeded by only one birth.

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dge ba thams cad kyi rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / sangs rgyas thams cad dang / 'phags pa thams cad la chos ston par gsol ba 'debs pa dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dge ba thams cad kyi rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / sangs rgyas thams cad dang / 'phags pa thams cad la chos ston par gsol ba 'debs pa dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang /
translated: The merit that is the basis of the virtuous action of rejoicing in all the virtues of the blessed buddhas of the past, present, and future, and the merit that is the basis of the virtuous action of requesting all the noble beings and all the buddhas to teach the Dharma,

original: dge ba thams cad byang chub tu bsngo ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / sems can byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa rnams byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam ston pa dang /

original: chos la rin po che rin thang med pa bzhin du yongs su tshol ba'i brtson 'grus dang / chos smra ba la dga' zhing @331a *//
analyzed: chos la rin po che rin thang med pa bzhin du yongs su tshol ba'i brtson 'grus dang / chos smra ba la dga' zhing @331a *//
translated: They are diligence in seeking the Dharma like a priceless jewel;

original: dpag tshad brgyar yang song ste chos nyan pas chog mi shes pa dang / zang zing med par chos 'chad pa dang / pha dang ma la rim gro byed pa dang / byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa shes pa dang / 'gyod pa med pa dang /
analyzed: dpag tshad brgyar yang song ste chos nyan pas chog mi shes pa dang / zang zing med par chos 'chad pa dang / pha dang ma la rim gro byed pa dang / byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa shes pa dang / 'gyod pa med pa dang /
translated: being insatiable in listening to the Dharma, even if one has to travel a hundred leagues to hear it; teaching the Dharma without material interest; serving one’s father and mother; being grateful; being appreciative; being free of regret;

original: bsod nams bsags pas chog mi shes pa dang / lus bsdams shing tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / ngag bsdams pa'i ngag la tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / yid bsdams pa'i yid la tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten btsugs pa'i phyir tshangs pa'i bsod nams yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: bsod nams bsags pas chog mi shes pa dang / lus bsdams shing tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / ngag bsdams pa'i ngag la tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / yid bsdams pa'i yid la tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten btsugs pa'i phyir tshangs pa'i bsod nams yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
translated: being insatiable in accumulating merit; being restrained in one’s body and free of hypocrisy; being restrained in one’s speech and free of hypocrisy; being restrained in one’s mind and free of hypocrisy; and being a holder of the merit of Brahmā in order to establish a stūpa of the Tathāgata.

original: mchod sbyin gtan pa med pa bsags pas mtshan yongs su rdzogs pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs sna tshogs bsags pas dpe byad bzang po yongs su rdzogs pa dang / nga rgyal med pas lus brgyan pa dang / ngag gi nyes pa thams cad spangs pas dag brgyan pa dang /
analyzed: mchod sbyin gtan pa med pa bsags pas mtshan yongs su rdzogs pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs sna tshogs bsags pas dpe byad bzang po yongs su rdzogs pa dang / nga rgyal med pas lus brgyan pa dang / ngag gi nyes pa thams cad spangs pas dag brgyan pa dang /
translated: The adornment of the body is due to the absence of pride. The adornment of speech is due to the abandonment of all faults of speech.

original: blo thogs pa med pas sems brgyan pa dang / mngon par shes pa sprul pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan dang / ye shes yongs su dag pas chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi rgyan dang / phra ma dang / zhe gcod pa dang / dbye ba'i tshig yongs su spangs pas 'khor mang po'i rgyan dang /
analyzed: blo thogs pa med pas sems brgyan pa dang / mngon par shes pa sprul pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan dang / ye shes yongs su dag pas chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi rgyan dang / phra ma dang / zhe gcod pa dang / dbye ba'i tshig yongs su spangs pas 'khor mang po'i rgyan dang /
translated: The adornment of mind is due to the unobstructed mind. The adornment of the buddhafield is due to the emanation of supernormal knowledge. The adornment of the characteristics of phenomena is due to the purity of wisdom. The adornment of the retinue is due to the abandonment of divisive, harsh, and slanderous speech.

original: chos 'dzin pas 'dod chags med pa'i chos kyi rgyan dang / rab tu dga' nas legs so //
analyzed: chos 'dzin pas 'dod chags med pa'i chos kyi rgyan dang / rab tu dga' nas legs so //
translated: The adornment of the Dharma of non-attachment is due to upholding the Dharma.🔽The Blessed One said, Excellent, excellent, Subhūti!

original: zhes bya ba byin nas chos kyi gtam mi 'jigs par byed pa dang / sgrib pa dang @331b chod pa rnam par spangs shing gus par chos nyan pas 'bras bu yod par chos 'chad pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams la dka' thub kyi nags tshal phul bas byang chub kyi zhing gi rgyan dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba byin nas chos kyi gtam mi 'jigs par byed pa dang / sgrib pa dang @331b chod pa rnam par spangs shing gus par chos nyan pas 'bras bu yod par chos 'chad pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams la dka' thub kyi nags tshal phul bas byang chub kyi zhing gi rgyan dang /
translated: By offering the forest of austerities to the buddhas, they have the adornments of the buddhafields.🔽By being preceded by all roots of virtue and by not abandoning the thought of awakening, they have the adornments of the seat of awakening.🔽By not observing karma and afflictions, they have the purity of birth and death.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sngon du 'gro zhing byang chub kyi sems mi gtong bas byang chub kyi snying po'i rgyan dang / las dang nyon mongs pa mi dmigs pas tshe dang shi 'pho yongs su dag pa dang / rin po che phangs pa'i dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong bas lag na rin po che dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sngon du 'gro zhing byang chub kyi sems mi gtong bas byang chub kyi snying po'i rgyan dang / las dang nyon mongs pa mi dmigs pas tshe dang shi 'pho yongs su dag pa dang / rin po che phangs pa'i dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong bas lag na rin po che dang /
translated: By giving away all precious things, they have the precious jewel.

original: mi zad pa'i smon lam thob pas longs spyod mi zad pa dang / khro gnyer med pas mthong ma thag tu sems can rnams dad cing bzhin 'dzum pas gsong por smra ba dang / sems can thams cad la 'od zer snyoms pas mnyam pa nyid kyi rgyan thob pa dang /
analyzed: mi zad pa'i smon lam thob pas longs spyod mi zad pa dang / khro gnyer med pas mthong ma thag tu sems can rnams dad cing bzhin 'dzum pas gsong por smra ba dang / sems can thams cad la 'od zer snyoms pas mnyam pa nyid kyi rgyan thob pa dang /
translated: By attaining the inexhaustible aspiration, they have inexhaustible wealth; by being free of frowns, beings feel faith as soon as they see them, and so they speak in a friendly way with a smiling face; by being impartial to all beings, they obtain the ornament of impartiality;

original: ma lobs pa la mi brnyas pas 'od mang po gtong ba dang / tshul khrims kyi bsod nams bsags pas skye ba yongs su dag pa dang / ltung ba la mi rtsod pas mngal yongs su dag pa dang / dge ba bcu'i las yongs su dag pas lha dang mir skye ba dang /
analyzed: ma lobs pa la mi brnyas pas 'od mang po gtong ba dang / tshul khrims kyi bsod nams bsags pas skye ba yongs su dag pa dang / ltung ba la mi rtsod pas mngal yongs su dag pa dang / dge ba bcu'i las yongs su dag pas lha dang mir skye ba dang /
translated: by not despising those who are not well trained, they emit many lights; by accumulating the merit of discipline, they have a pure rebirth; by not arguing about downfalls, they have a pure womb; and by being pure in the ten virtues, they are reborn as gods or humans.

original: rjes su bstan pa thams cad la rab tu rtog pas gdon mi za bar nod pa dang / chos la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med pas chos kyi dbang phyug dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pas 'jig rten thams cad la mngon sum pa dang /
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa thams cad la rab tu rtog pas gdon mi za bar nod pa dang / chos la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med pas chos kyi dbang phyug dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pas 'jig rten thams cad la mngon sum pa dang /
translated: By thoroughly investigating all the teachings, they are certain to take them up; by not being stingy with the Dharma like a teacher, they are masters of the Dharma; by having a completely pure altruistic attitude, they are in the presence of all worlds;

original: nyi tshe ba'i spyod pa mi 'dod pas rgya chen po'i chos la dad pa dang / @332a *//
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i spyod pa mi 'dod pas rgya chen po'i chos la dad pa dang / @332a *//
translated: It is to have faith in the vast Dharma because one does not wish for limited conduct.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems mi 'dor bas bsod nams thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa dang / dad pa sngon du 'gro bas nor bdun yongs su rdzogs pa dang / sngon dam bcas pa nyams su lon par byed pas 'jig rten thams cad mi slu ba dang /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems mi 'dor bas bsod nams thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa dang / dad pa sngon du 'gro bas nor bdun yongs su rdzogs pa dang / sngon dam bcas pa nyams su lon par byed pas 'jig rten thams cad mi slu ba dang /
translated: It is to uphold all merit because one does not abandon the mind of omniscience. It is to perfect the seven riches because faith is foremost. It is to not deceive any world because one fulfills one’s former vows.

original: dge ba'i chos yongs su rdzogs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa ste; de ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos yongs su rdzogs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa ste; de ni /
translated: It is to perfect all the qualities of the Buddha because one perfects virtuous qualities.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “This is called the bodhisatvas’ skill in the accumulation of merit.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi tshogs la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi tshogs la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisatvas’ skill in the accumulation of wisdom?

original: rgyu gang gis ye shes skye ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis ye shes skye ba ste /
translated: It is the cause of the arising of wisdom.

original: de ltar rgyu dang / rkyen gang dang gang gis ye shes rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang / rkyen gang dang gang gis ye shes rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the realization of wisdom through any cause or condition.

original: de la rgyu gang /
analyzed: de la rgyu gang /
translated: “What is a cause?

original: rkyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: rkyen gang zhe na /
translated: What is a condition?

original: chos tshol ba la rab tu 'dun pa dang / ye shes kyi rjes su song ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la rton gyi /
analyzed: chos tshol ba la rab tu 'dun pa dang / ye shes kyi rjes su song ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la rton gyi /
translated: They are: being very keen to seek the Dharma, relying on a spiritual master who is in accord with wisdom, and relying on the wisdom of the Buddha.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mi rton pa dang / de dag la nga rgyal mi byed pa dang / bla ma la dga' ba dang / ston pa la dga' ba dang / de'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag gis 'di ni /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mi rton pa dang / de dag la nga rgyal mi byed pa dang / bla ma la dga' ba dang / ston pa la dga' ba dang / de'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag gis 'di ni /
translated: They are: being very intent on seeking the Dharma; relying on spiritual friends who are intent on wisdom; relying on the wisdom of the Buddhas, not the wisdom of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas; not being proud of those; being devoted to the gurus; being devoted to the teachers; and those spiritual friends, knowing that one has the intention, do not fail to teach any of the wisdom teachings.🔽Knowing that one is a suitable vessel, they teach the Dharma with an undistracted mind.

original: bsam pa dang ldan par shes nas ye shes kyi gtam gang yang mi ston pa med pa dang / snod du shes nas bar chad med par sems rtse gcig tu chos ston pa dang / des chos de thos nas chos kyi tshogs la brtson par byed de /
analyzed: bsam pa dang ldan par shes nas ye shes kyi gtam gang yang mi ston pa med pa dang / snod du shes nas bar chad med par sems rtse gcig tu chos ston pa dang / des chos de thos nas chos kyi tshogs la brtson par byed de /
translated: Having heard that Dharma, one strives in the accumulation of the Dharma.

original: gang chos kyi tshogs la brtson par byed pa de nyid de'i ye shes @332b kyi tshogs la brtson pa yin no //
analyzed: gang chos kyi tshogs la brtson par byed pa de nyid de'i ye shes @332b kyi tshogs la brtson pa yin no //
translated: That striving in the accumulation of the Dharma is itself striving in the accumulation of wisdom.

original: de la chos kyi tshogs la brtson pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos kyi tshogs la brtson pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is striving in the accumulation of the Dharma?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽don nyung ba dang / bya ba nyung ba dang / sgra nyung ba dang / srod dang tho rangs la mi nyal zhing rnal 'byor la brtson pa dang / 'brel ba'i don la yongs su rtog pa dang / phyir zhing yongs su tshol ba dang /🔽sems la rnyog pa med pa dang / sgrib pa gnon pa dang / ltung ba las 'byung bar shes pa dang / 'gyod pa med pa dang / kun nas ldang ba med pa dang / nan tan snying por byed pa dang / chos la gzhol ba dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / don nyung ba dang / bya ba nyung ba dang / sgra nyung ba dang / srod dang tho rangs la mi nyal zhing rnal 'byor la brtson pa dang / 'brel ba'i don la yongs su rtog pa dang / phyir zhing yongs su tshol ba dang / sems la rnyog pa med pa dang / sgrib pa gnon pa dang / ltung ba las 'byung bar shes pa dang / 'gyod pa med pa dang / kun nas ldang ba med pa dang / nan tan snying por byed pa dang / chos la gzhol ba dang /

original: khyad par du 'gro ba dang / 'du 'dzi las dben pa dang / gcig pur dga' ba dang / dgon pa'i bde ba yid la byed pa dang / 'phags pa'i rigs la dga' ba dang / sbyangs pa las mi 'gyur ba dang / chos kyi kun dga' la dga' zhing mos pa dang /
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba dang / 'du 'dzi las dben pa dang / gcig pur dga' ba dang / dgon pa'i bde ba yid la byed pa dang / 'phags pa'i rigs la dga' ba dang / sbyangs pa las mi 'gyur ba dang / chos kyi kun dga' la dga' zhing mos pa dang /
translated: It is to be particularly advanced. It is to be secluded from busyness. It is to delight in solitude. It is to keep in mind the bliss of the forest. It is to delight in the family of the noble ones. It is to be unmoved by asceticism. It is to delight in and be devoted to the joy of the Dharma.

original: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i gsang tshig la ri mor mi byed pa dang / 'jig rten las 'ongs pa'i chos tshol ba la dran pa mi nyams pa dang / rtogs pa la don rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / blo gros la lam gyi rjes su mthun par byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i gsang tshig la ri mor mi byed pa dang / 'jig rten las 'ongs pa'i chos tshol ba la dran pa mi nyams pa dang / rtogs pa la don rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / blo gros la lam gyi rjes su mthun par byed pa dang /
translated: It is to not be impressed by the secret words of the Lokāyatas. It is to not lose mindfulness in the search for the Dharma that comes from the world. It is to understand the meaning of realization. It is to be in accord with the path of intelligence.

original: mos pa la sdom pa dang / rkyen la ye shes kyi rjes su rig pa dang / khrel yod @333a *//
analyzed: mos pa la sdom pa dang / rkyen la ye shes kyi rjes su rig pa dang / khrel yod @333a *//
translated: It is to be bound by devotion. It is to be aware of the wisdom of conditions. It is to have a sense of shame.

original: rab tu rnam par dag pa dang / blo rgya che ba dang / blo ma zhum pa dang / blo rab tu tha dad pa dang / mngon sum du shes pa dang / gzhan la rag ma lus pa'i yon tan dang / rang gi yon tan gyis mi snyems pa dang /

translated: the very pure, the vast mind, the undaunted mind, the very different mind, direct knowledge, the quality of not depending on others, not being conceited by one’s own qualities,

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /

analyzed: stobs lnga po de dag ye shes kyi tshogs su 'gyur ro //

analyzed: tshul khrims bzhi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /

analyzed: tshul khrims bzhi po de dag ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bzod pa bzhi po de dag ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: brtson 'grus bzhi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /

analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:
