translated: It is without an agent.🔽It is without a master.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa /
translated: It is without a possessor.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / phyi rol gyi rtsva dang / shing gel pa dang / sman dang nags tshal dag rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung zhing bdag po med pa /
analyzed: dper na / phyi rol gyi rtsva dang / shing gel pa dang / sman dang nags tshal dag rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung zhing bdag po med pa /
translated: For example, external grass, trees, vines, medicinal herbs, and forests arise from causes and conditions, and are without a master.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa de bzhin du lus 'di yang rtsva dang / rtsig pa dang / shing dang / bong ba dang / mig yor lta bu phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bdag dang bdag gi'am /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa de bzhin du lus 'di yang rtsva dang / rtsig pa dang / shing dang / bong ba dang / mig yor lta bu phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bdag dang bdag gi'am /
translated: In the same way, this body is like grass, walls, trees, clods of earth, or illusions, and is empty of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, of “I” and “mine,”

original: rtag pa'am / brtan pa'am /🔽ther zug gam /
analyzed: rtag pa'am / brtan pa'am / ther zug gam /
translated: of permanence, stability,🔽eternity,

original: mi 'gyur ba'i chos kyis stong ste /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i chos kyis stong ste /
translated: and immutability.

original: lus de la nga yir mi bya'i /
analyzed: lus de la nga yir mi bya'i /
translated: Do not take that body as “mine.”

original: lus snying po med pa des snying po blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: lus snying po med pa des snying po blang bar bya'o //
translated: Take the essence from that body, which is without essence.

original: de la snying po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la snying po gang zhe na /
translated: What is that essence?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'o //
translated: The body of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni /
translated: The body of the Tathāgata

original: chos kyi sku /
analyzed: chos kyi sku /
translated: is the body of Dharma,

original: rdo rje'i sku /
analyzed: rdo rje'i sku /
translated: the vajra body,🔽and

original: mi phyed pa'i sku /
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i sku /
translated: an indivisible body,

original: sra ba'i sku /
analyzed: sra ba'i sku /
translated: a solid body,

original: 'jig rten gsum po thams cad dang khyad zhugs pa'i sku bdag gis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po thams cad dang khyad zhugs pa'i sku bdag gis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: a body that is superior to the entire world.

original: bdag gi lus 'di nyes pa du @336a *//
analyzed: bdag gi lus 'di nyes pa du @336a *//
translated: “ ‘This body of mine is flawed

original: ma'i skyon chags mod kyi /
analyzed: ma'i skyon chags mod kyi /
translated: with many faults,

original: 'on kyang nyes pa thams cad dang bral ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku thob par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang nyes pa thams cad dang bral ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku thob par bya'o //
translated: but I will attain the body of the Tathāgata, which is free from all faults.’

original: zhes de so sor rtog pa'i mthus logs par mthong nas 'byung ba chen po'i gnas kyi lus yongs su srung bar byed de /
analyzed: zhes de so sor rtog pa'i mthus logs par mthong nas 'byung ba chen po'i gnas kyi lus yongs su srung bar byed de /
translated: “ ‘Through the power of discernment, I see this body as other, and I will protect the body that is the abode of the great elements.

original: nga'i lus ni /
analyzed: nga'i lus ni /
translated: This body of mine

original: sems can thams cad kyi ci dgos par zad par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi ci dgos par zad par bya'o //
translated: will be used for the needs of all beings.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like

original: dper na / phyi rol gyi 'byung ba chen po bzhi po sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams sgo sna tshogs dang / dmigs pa sna tshogs dang / rnam grangs sna tshogs dang / yo byad sna tshogs dang /
analyzed: dper na / phyi rol gyi 'byung ba chen po bzhi po sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams sgo sna tshogs dang / dmigs pa sna tshogs dang / rnam grangs sna tshogs dang / yo byad sna tshogs dang /
translated: the four external great elements—the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element—which have various doors, various objects, various enumerations, and various implements.

original: yongs su spyod pa sna tshogs kyis sems can rnams nye bar 'tsho ba de bzhin du bdag gi 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'i lus 'di sgo sna tshogs dang / dmigs pa sna tshogs dang / rnam grangs sna tshogs dang / yongs su spyod pa sna tshogs kyis sems can rnams kyi nye bar 'tsho bar gyur cig snyam mo //
analyzed: yongs su spyod pa sna tshogs kyis sems can rnams nye bar 'tsho ba de bzhin du bdag gi 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'i lus 'di sgo sna tshogs dang / dmigs pa sna tshogs dang / rnam grangs sna tshogs dang / yongs su spyod pa sna tshogs kyis sems can rnams kyi nye bar 'tsho bar gyur cig snyam mo //
translated: In the same way, may this body of mine, which is made of the four great elements, be a source of life for sentient beings, through various activities, various objects, various means, and various uses.

original: de'i lus mi rtag pa nyid du yang so sor rtog mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i lus mi rtag pa nyid du yang so sor rtog mod kyi /
translated: He contemplates the impermanence of the body,

original: skye ba dang / shi 'phos kyang mi skyo'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang / shi 'phos kyang mi skyo'o //
translated: but he is not discouraged by birth and death.

original: lus sdug bsngal nyid du so sor rtog mod kyi /
analyzed: lus sdug bsngal nyid du so sor rtog mod kyi /
translated: He contemplates the suffering of the body,

original: lus kyi sdug bsngal bas kyang yongs su mi gdung ngo //
analyzed: lus kyi sdug bsngal bas kyang yongs su mi gdung ngo //
translated: but he is not tormented by the suffering of the body.

original: lus bdag med pa nyid du yang so sor rtog mod kyi /
analyzed: lus bdag med pa nyid du yang so sor rtog mod kyi /
translated: He contemplates the selflessness of the body,

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la yang mi skyo'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la yang mi skyo'o //
translated: but he is not discouraged by the ripening of sentient beings.

original: lus zhi ba nyid du yang so sor rtog mod kyi /
analyzed: lus zhi ba nyid du yang so sor rtog mod kyi /
translated: He contemplates the peace of the body,🔽but he does not fall into the peace of the body.

original: lus zhi bas btang @336b snyoms su yang mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: lus zhi bas btang @336b snyoms su yang mi ltung ngo //
translated: And because his body is peaceful, he does not fall into a state of indifference.

original: lus stong pa nyid dang / lus dben pa nyid du yang so sor rtog mod kyi /
analyzed: lus stong pa nyid dang / lus dben pa nyid du yang so sor rtog mod kyi /
translated: He contemplates the emptiness of the body and the isolation of the body,

original: dben pa'i mur yang mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: dben pa'i mur yang mi ltung ngo //
translated: but he does not fall into the extreme of isolation.

original: de lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na lus la rdzas dang snying por rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na lus la rdzas dang snying por rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: When he dwells contemplating the body in the body, he does not see the body as substantial or as having essence.

original: nang gi lus la yang lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na nang gi rjes su song ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi go skabs mi 'byed do //
analyzed: nang gi lus la yang lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na nang gi rjes su song ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi go skabs mi 'byed do //
translated: When he dwells contemplating the internal body in the body, he does not give an opportunity to internal reactive emotions.

original: de phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na phyi rol gyi rjes su song ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas so //
analyzed: de phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na phyi rol gyi rjes su song ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas so //
translated: When he dwells contemplating the external body in the body, he does not dwell together with external reactive emotions.

original: de la lus nyon mongs pa med pas lus kyi las yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la lus nyon mongs pa med pas lus kyi las yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Since his body is free of reactive emotions, his physical actions are completely pure.

original: de lus yongs su dag nas mtshan gyis yang dag par brgyan pa'i sku 'thob bo //
analyzed: de lus yongs su dag nas mtshan gyis yang dag par brgyan pa'i sku 'thob bo //
translated: When his body is pure, he attains a body adorned with the major and minor marks.

original: de lus brgyan par gyur nas lha dang mi rnams mngon du 'du bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lus brgyan par gyur nas lha dang mi rnams mngon du 'du bar 'gyur te /
translated: When he adorns his body, gods and humans gather around him.

original: de ni / byang chub sems dpa'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom pa'o //🔽yang ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ni / byang chub sems dpa'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom pa'o // yang ji ltar na /
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s cultivation of mindfulness of the body as a mental application observing the body.

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does the bodhisattva cultivate mindfulness of feelings as a mental application observing the body?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' gang ci tshor yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' gang ci tshor yang rung ste /
translated: Here the bodhisattva thinks whatever feeling I experience

original: de thams cad sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: de thams cad sdug bsngal lo //
translated: all of it is suffering.

original: zhes de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: zhes de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks this way:

original: de ye shes kyis rtogs pa dang / shes rab kyis rtogs pa dang / thabs kyis rtogs pa'i tshor ba shin tu rtogs pas bde bar tshor pa tshor bar yang byed mod kyi /🔽'dod chags kyi bag la nyal yang bag la @337a *//
analyzed: de ye shes kyis rtogs pa dang / shes rab kyis rtogs pa dang / thabs kyis rtogs pa'i tshor ba shin tu rtogs pas bde bar tshor pa tshor bar yang byed mod kyi / 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal yang bag la @337a *//
translated: By understanding feelings through his knowledge, his understanding, and his skillful means, he experiences pleasant feelings.

original: nyal bar mi byed do //
analyzed: nyal bar mi byed do //
translated: But he does not allow the latent tendency to attraction to lie latent.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i tshor bas reg nas kyang ngan song du skyes pa thams cad la snying rje chen po bskyed cing khong khro ba'i bag la nyal ba yang bag la nyal bar mi byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i tshor bas reg nas kyang ngan song du skyes pa thams cad la snying rje chen po bskyed cing khong khro ba'i bag la nyal ba yang bag la nyal bar mi byed do //
translated: When they experience painful feelings, they generate great compassion for all those who have been born in the lower realms, and they do not allow the latent tendency to anger to lie dormant.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor bas reg kyang ma rig pa'i bag la nyal yang bag la nyal bar mi byed do //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor bas reg kyang ma rig pa'i bag la nyal yang bag la nyal bar mi byed do //
translated: When they experience feelings that are neither painful nor pleasant, they do not allow the latent tendency to ignorance to lie dormant.

original: de tshor ba'i rjes su song ba'i dran pas bde ba'am /
analyzed: de tshor ba'i rjes su song ba'i dran pas bde ba'am /
translated: “With mindfulness that is directed to feelings, they see the arising and passing away of any pleasant,

original: sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: painful, or

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba gang tshor ba yang tshor ba de dag las 'byung bar lta ba yin no //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba gang tshor ba yang tshor ba de dag las 'byung bar lta ba yin no //
translated: neutral feelings that they experience.

original: sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba yongs su shes shing zhi ba'i phyir yang 'jug ste /🔽sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba yongs su shes shing zhi ba'i phyir yang 'jug ste / sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: They also engage in the knowledge of the feelings of all sentient beings and the pacification of those feelings.

original: tshor ba las 'byung ba mi shes pas de dag bde ba'i tshor ba la dga' bar byed /
analyzed: tshor ba las 'byung ba mi shes pas de dag bde ba'i tshor ba la dga' bar byed /
translated: ‘These sentient beings do not know how to transcend feelings. Therefore, they delight in pleasant feelings,🔽are hostile toward painful feelings,🔽and are confused about feelings that are neither pleasant nor painful.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i tshor ba la zhe sdang bar byed /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i tshor ba la zhe sdang bar byed /
translated: They are angry at painful feelings,

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la rmongs par byed kyi /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la rmongs par byed kyi /
translated: and confused by feelings that are neither painful nor pleasant.

original: bdag ni / shes rab dang / ye shes kyis rjes su rtogs pa'i tshor ba thams cad so sor sbyangs pa dang / thabs mkhas pa dang snying rje chen pos yongs su bzung ba'i rtsom pas sems can de dag gi tshor ba thams cad rgyun gcad pa'i phyir chos bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag ni / shes rab dang / ye shes kyis rjes su rtogs pa'i tshor ba thams cad so sor sbyangs pa dang / thabs mkhas pa dang snying rje chen pos yongs su bzung ba'i rtsom pas sems can de dag gi tshor ba thams cad rgyun gcad pa'i phyir chos bstan par bya'o //
translated: But I will teach the Dharma so that all beings may be free from all feelings, by means of the wisdom and knowledge that I have realized, by means of the purification of all feelings, and by means of the practice that is embraced by skillful means and great compassion.

original: ci'i phyir tshor ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshor ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: “And why are they called ‘feelings’?

original: rtogs pa'i tshor ba ni /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i tshor ba ni /
translated: When there is understanding,

original: bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: there is pleasure.

original: ma rtogs pa'i tshor ba ni /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'i tshor ba ni /
translated: When there is no understanding,

original: sdug @337b bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug @337b bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: there is pain.

original: de la rtogs pa'i tshor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rtogs pa'i tshor ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is understanding?

original: 'di la bdag gam /
analyzed: 'di la bdag gam /
translated: There is no self,

original: sems can nam /
analyzed: sems can nam /
translated: no sentient being,

original: srog gam / gang zag gang yang tshor bar byed pa med de /🔽chags pa ni /
analyzed: srog gam / gang zag gang yang tshor bar byed pa med de / chags pa ni /
translated: no life-force, and no person who feels.🔽Attachment

original: tshor pa'o // yongs su 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: tshor pa'o // yongs su 'dzin pa ni /
translated: is feeling.

original: tshor ba'o // len pa ni /
analyzed: tshor ba'o // len pa ni /
translated: Feeling is grasping.

original: tshor ba'o // phyin ci log ni /
analyzed: tshor ba'o // phyin ci log ni /
translated: Feeling is the perversions.

original: tshor ba'o // rnam par rtog pa ni /🔽tshor ba'o // lta ba'i bag la nyal ni /
analyzed: tshor ba'o // rnam par rtog pa ni / tshor ba'o // lta ba'i bag la nyal ni /
translated: Feeling is conceptualization.🔽Feeling is the latent tendencies of views.

original: tshor ba'o // mig tu 'du /
analyzed: tshor ba'o // mig tu 'du /
translated: Feeling is the eye.

original: shes pa tshor ba yin pa nas yid kyi bar du 'du shes pa ni /
analyzed: shes pa tshor ba yin pa nas yid kyi bar du 'du shes pa ni /
translated: Feeling is the recognition of the eye up to the mind.

original: tshor ba'o // gzugs su 'du shes pa tshor ba yin pa nas chos su 'du shes pa'i bar du ni /
analyzed: tshor ba'o // gzugs su 'du shes pa tshor ba yin pa nas chos su 'du shes pa'i bar du ni /
translated: Feeling is the recognition of form up to the recognition of dharmas.

original: tshor ba'o // gang mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba'am /🔽bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i bar du de ni /
analyzed: tshor ba'o // gang mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i bar du de ni /
translated: Feeling is the pleasant, unpleasant, or neutral feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the eye.🔽Feeling is the pleasant, unpleasant, or neutral feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the ear.

original: tshor ba zhes bya'o //🔽gong ma bzhin du nang dang phyi'i chos rnams la sbyar te /
analyzed: tshor ba zhes bya'o // gong ma bzhin du nang dang phyi'i chos rnams la sbyar te /
translated: Feeling is the pleasant, unpleasant, or neutral feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the nose.🔽Feeling is the pleasant, unpleasant, or neutral feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the tongue.🔽Feeling is the pleasant, unpleasant, or neutral feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the body.

original: yid kyi bar du 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: yid kyi bar du 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: Feeling is the pleasant, unpleasant, or neutral feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the mind.🔽Feeling is the pleasant, unpleasant, or neutral feeling that arises from the condition of contact with internal and external dharmas.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i bar du de ni /🔽tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i bar du de ni / tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: up to neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant is feeling.

original: gzhan yang rnam grangs kyis tshor ba gcig ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam grangs kyis tshor ba gcig ste /
translated: Moreover, there is a single feeling in terms of enumeration,

original: de ni / sems gcig pus rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de ni / sems gcig pus rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: which is the mind alone that is aware.

original: tshor ba gnyis te /
analyzed: tshor ba gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of feeling,

original: phyi dang / nang gi'o //
analyzed: phyi dang / nang gi'o //
translated: external and internal.

original: tshor ba gsum ste /
analyzed: tshor ba gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of feeling,

original: 'das pa rnam par rig pa dang / ma 'ongs pa rnam par rig pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa rnam par rig pa dang / ma 'ongs pa rnam par rig pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: awareness of the past, awareness of the future, and awareness of the present.

original: tshor ba bzhi ste /🔽de ni / khams bzhi rnam @338a *//
analyzed: tshor ba bzhi ste / de ni / khams bzhi rnam @338a *//
translated: There are four kinds of feeling,

original: par rig pa'o //
analyzed: par rig pa'o //
translated: which are the awareness of the four elements.

original: tshor ba lnga ste /
analyzed: tshor ba lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds of feeling,

original: de ni / phung po lnga yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni / phung po lnga yid la byed pa'o //
translated: which are the five aggregates.

original: tshor ba drug ste /
analyzed: tshor ba drug ste /
translated: There are six kinds of feeling,

original: de ni / skye mched drug yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de ni / skye mched drug yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: which are the six sense bases.

original: tshor ba bdun te /
analyzed: tshor ba bdun te /
translated: There are seven kinds of feeling,

original: de ni / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa bdun no //
analyzed: de ni / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa bdun no //
translated: which are the seven abodes of consciousness.

original: tshor ba brgyad de /
analyzed: tshor ba brgyad de /
translated: There are eight kinds of feeling,

original: de ni / log par nges pa'i sbyor ba brgyad do //
analyzed: de ni / log par nges pa'i sbyor ba brgyad do //
translated: which are the eight wrong engagements.

original: tshor ba dgu ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dgu ste /
translated: There are nine kinds of feeling,🔽which are the nine abodes of sentient beings.

original: de ni / sems can gyi gnas dgu'o //
analyzed: de ni / sems can gyi gnas dgu'o //
translated: These are the nine abodes of sentient beings.

original: tshor ba bcu ste /
analyzed: tshor ba bcu ste /
translated: There are ten kinds of feelings.

original: de ni / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mo //
analyzed: de ni / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mo //
translated: These are the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: gong ma bzhin du sbyar te /🔽thams cad ni /
analyzed: gong ma bzhin du sbyar te / thams cad ni /
translated: The same method applies to the rest.

original: tshor ba ste /
analyzed: tshor ba ste /
translated: All of them are feelings.

original: dmigs pa ji snyed pa dang / yid la byed pa ji snyed pa de thams cad tshor bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ji snyed pa dang / yid la byed pa ji snyed pa de thams cad tshor bar bya ba'o //
translated: As many as are the objects and as many as are the mental activities, all of them are to be felt.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: sems can tshad med pas tshor ba tshad med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can tshad med pas tshor ba tshad med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is said that the feelings of sentient beings are immeasurable.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing gnas pas sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba skyes ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa la ye shes bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing gnas pas sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba skyes ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa la ye shes bskyed par bya ste /
translated: Therein, the bodhisattva, by abiding in the contemplation of the feelings as feelings, should generate the knowledge of the arising, passing away, and remaining of the feelings of all sentient beings.

original: gang sems can thams cad kyi dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i tshor ba la tshor ba shes pa de ni /
analyzed: gang sems can thams cad kyi dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i tshor ba la tshor ba shes pa de ni /
translated: That knowledge of the feelings, wholesome and unwholesome, of all sentient beings,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: is the bodhisattva’s close placement of mindfulness of feelings as feelings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s application of mindfulness as watchful attention to the mind?

original: gang byang chub sems dpa'i mi brjed pa dang / sba ba dang / kun srung ba dang / mi g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa'i mi brjed pa dang / sba ba dang / kun srung ba dang / mi g-yeng ba'o //
translated: It is the bodhisattva’s non-forgetfulness, non-transgression, protection, and non-distraction.

original: de 'di ltar so sor rtog ste /
analyzed: de 'di ltar so sor rtog ste /
translated: He reflects in the following way:

original: sems ni / skyes nas 'jig cing zhu ste mi gnas pas nang @338b na yang mi gnas /
analyzed: sems ni / skyes nas 'jig cing zhu ste mi gnas pas nang @338b na yang mi gnas /
translated: The mind is born, ceases, and dissolves, and does not remain. It does not remain internally,

original: phyi rol tu yang mi 'pho ste /🔽gang bdag gis thog mar sems bskyed pa de yang zad med /
analyzed: phyi rol tu yang mi 'pho ste / gang bdag gis thog mar sems bskyed pa de yang zad med /
translated: nor does it go externally.

original: rnam par gyur te yul na mi gnas /
analyzed: rnam par gyur te yul na mi gnas /
translated: The mind that I first generated has ceased and changed. It does not remain in a place,

original: phyogs na mi gnas pas de rnyed par mi nus te /🔽sems gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba bsgrubs pa de dag kyang zad med /
analyzed: phyogs na mi gnas pas de rnyed par mi nus te / sems gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba bsgrubs pa de dag kyang zad med /
translated: nor does it remain in a direction. It cannot be found.

original: rnam par gyur /
analyzed: rnam par gyur /
translated: The mind by which I have accomplished roots of virtue has ceased and changed.

original: yul na mi gnas /
analyzed: yul na mi gnas /
translated: It does not remain in a place,

original: phyogs na mi gnas so //
analyzed: phyogs na mi gnas so //
translated: nor does it remain in a direction.

original: gang yang byang chub tu bsngos pa'i sems de yang ngo bo nyid kyis mtshan nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang byang chub tu bsngos pa'i sems de yang ngo bo nyid kyis mtshan nyid med pa ste /
translated: The mind that I have dedicated to awakening is also essentially without a sign.

original: sems kyis sems rab tu mi shes /🔽sems kyis sems mi mthong /
analyzed: sems kyis sems rab tu mi shes / sems kyis sems mi mthong /
translated: The mind does not know the mind.🔽The mind does not see the mind.

original: sems kyis sems mi tshor na /
analyzed: sems kyis sems mi tshor na /
translated: The mind does not feel the mind.

original: gang gis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i sems de gang yin /
analyzed: gang gis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i sems de gang yin /
translated: What is that mind by which I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: gang byang chub kyi sems de ni /
analyzed: gang byang chub kyi sems de ni /
translated: That mind of awakening

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dang mi 'grogs /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dang mi 'grogs /
translated: does not accompany the mind of roots of virtue.

original: gang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems de yang bsngo ba'i sems dang mi 'grogs /
analyzed: gang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems de yang bsngo ba'i sems dang mi 'grogs /
translated: That mind of roots of virtue does not accompany the mind of dedication.

original: gang bsngo ba'i sems de yang byang chub kyi sems dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dang mi 'grogs so //
analyzed: gang bsngo ba'i sems de yang byang chub kyi sems dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dang mi 'grogs so //
translated: That mind of dedication does not accompany the mind of awakening and the mind of roots of virtue.

original: zhes de de ltar so sor rtog pa dang / mi skrag /
analyzed: zhes de de ltar so sor rtog pa dang / mi skrag /
translated: When they investigate in that way, they are not frightened,

original: mi dngang / dngang bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mi dngang / dngang bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: not terrified, and do not become terrified.

original: de yang 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de yang 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: They think like this:

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab mo rgyu dang / 'bras bu chud mi za ba'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab mo rgyu dang / 'bras bu chud mi za ba'o //
translated: “Deep dependent origination does not waste causes and effects.”

original: gal te sems kyi chos nyid de lta bu sems kyi rang bzhin nyid yin yang chos thams cad rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa /
analyzed: gal te sems kyi chos nyid de lta bu sems kyi rang bzhin nyid yin yang chos thams cad rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa /
translated: Even if the nature of mind is suchness, all phenomena depend on causes and conditions.

original: g-yo ba med pa /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa /
translated: They are unmoving,

original: byed pa med pa /
analyzed: byed pa med pa /
translated: without action,🔽and without a master.

original: bdag po med pa ji ltar 'dod pa de @339a *//🔽bzhin du 'grub kyi /
analyzed: bdag po med pa ji ltar 'dod pa de @339a *// bzhin du 'grub kyi /
translated: As you wish,

original: bdag gis sgrub pa la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sgrub pa la brtson par bya'o //
translated: you should strive to accomplish it.

original: sems kyi chos nyid de mi 'bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid de mi 'bri bar bya'o //
translated: You should not draw away from the nature of mind.

original: de la sems kyi chos nyid gang /
analyzed: de la sems kyi chos nyid gang /
translated: What is the nature of mind?

original: sgrub pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is accomplishment?

original: sems ni / sgyu ma dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: sems ni / sgyu ma dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: The mind is like an illusion.

original: de la sgrib par byed pa su yang med de /
analyzed: de la sgrib par byed pa su yang med de /
translated: There is no one who obscures it.

original: de ni / sems kyi chos nyid do //
analyzed: de ni / sems kyi chos nyid do //
translated: That is the nature of mind.

original: gang yang bdog pa thams cad yongs su btang nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par sgrub pa'i rgyan du bsngo bar byed pa de ni /
analyzed: gang yang bdog pa thams cad yongs su btang nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par sgrub pa'i rgyan du bsngo bar byed pa de ni /
translated: Having given away all possessions, one should dedicate them as ornaments for the accomplishment of a buddhafield.

original: sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: That is accomplishment.

original: sems rmi lam dang 'dra ba rab tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid de ni /
analyzed: sems rmi lam dang 'dra ba rab tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid de ni /
translated: The mind is like a dream, with the characteristic of complete peace.

original: sems kyi chos nyid de /
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid de /
translated: That is the nature of mind.

original: gang yang tshul khrims sdom pa'i tshogs gsog go cog de thams cad myur ba'i mngon par shes par bsngo ba de ni /
analyzed: gang yang tshul khrims sdom pa'i tshogs gsog go cog de thams cad myur ba'i mngon par shes par bsngo ba de ni /
translated: Whatever accumulation of morality and vows one has, all of that is dedicated to the swift higher perceptions.🔽That is the practice.

original: sgrub pa'o // sems smig rgyu lta bu shin tu zad par gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: sgrub pa'o // sems smig rgyu lta bu shin tu zad par gyur pa de ni /
translated: The mind is like a mirage, and is completely exhausted.🔽That is the nature of the mind.

original: sems kyi chos nyid de gang yang bzod pa'i stobs dang / des pa byang chub kyi rgyan bsgrub pa'i phyir bsngo ba de ni /
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid de gang yang bzod pa'i stobs dang / des pa byang chub kyi rgyan bsgrub pa'i phyir bsngo ba de ni /
translated: The power of patience and gentleness is dedicated to the practice of the ornaments of enlightenment.

original: de'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: That is the practice.

original: sems chu zla lta bu shin tu dben pas dben pa de ni /
analyzed: sems chu zla lta bu shin tu dben pas dben pa de ni /
translated: The mind is like the reflection of the moon in water, and is completely isolated by being isolated.

original: sems kyi chos nyid de /
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid de /
translated: That is the nature of the mind.

original: gang yang brtson 'grus rtsom pa thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bsngo ba de ni /
analyzed: gang yang brtson 'grus rtsom pa thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bsngo ba de ni /
translated: All the exertion of striving is dedicated to perfecting all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: de'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: That is the practice.

original: sems gzung du med pa mi mthong ba de ni /
analyzed: sems gzung du med pa mi mthong ba de ni /
translated: The mind is ungraspable and invisible.

original: sems kyi chos nyid de /
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid de /
translated: That is the nature of the mind.

original: gang yang bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang mnyam par gzhag pa thams cad sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin du @339b bsngo ba de ni /
analyzed: gang yang bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang mnyam par gzhag pa thams cad sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin du @339b bsngo ba de ni /
translated: The dedication of all concentrations, liberations, samādhis, and absorptions to the samādhi of the buddhas

original: de'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: is their accomplishment.

original: sems gzugs med pa /
analyzed: sems gzugs med pa /
translated: The mind is formless,

original: mi mthong ba /🔽mi thogs pa /
analyzed: mi mthong ba / mi thogs pa /
translated: invisible,🔽unobstructed,

original: rnam par mi rig pa de ni /
analyzed: rnam par mi rig pa de ni /
translated: and non-apprehending.

original: sems kyi chos nyid de /
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid de /
translated: That is the true nature of the mind.

original: gang yang dris pa'i tshig tha dad pa bstan pa thams cad shes pas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bsngo ba de ni /
analyzed: gang yang dris pa'i tshig tha dad pa bstan pa thams cad shes pas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bsngo ba de ni /
translated: The dedication of all the different answers to questions to the perfect wisdom of the buddhas

original: de'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: is their accomplishment.

original: dmigs pa sna tshogs la sems skye ba de ni /🔽sems kyi chos nyid de /
analyzed: dmigs pa sna tshogs la sems skye ba de ni / sems kyi chos nyid de /
translated: The mind arises from various objects.🔽That is the true nature of the mind.

original: gang yang dge ba'i rtsa ba la dmigs pa'i sems nye bar sbyor ba de ni /
analyzed: gang yang dge ba'i rtsa ba la dmigs pa'i sems nye bar sbyor ba de ni /
translated: The application of the mind to the roots of virtue

original: de'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: is their accomplishment.

original: rgyu med pa las sems mi skye ba de ni /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las sems mi skye ba de ni /
translated: The mind does not arise without a cause.

original: sems kyi chos nyid de /
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid de /
translated: That is the true nature of the mind.

original: gang yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi rgyu'i sems bskyed pa de ni /
analyzed: gang yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi rgyu'i sems bskyed pa de ni /
translated: The generation of the mind that is the cause of the factors of awakening is

original: de'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: its accomplishment.

original: gang yul med par sems mi skye ba de ni /
analyzed: gang yul med par sems mi skye ba de ni /
translated: The mind that does not arise without an object is

original: de'i sems kyi chos nyid de /
analyzed: de'i sems kyi chos nyid de /
translated: the nature of the mind.🔽The application of the mind that is the cause of the domain of the buddhas is

original: gang yang sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi rgyu'i sems nye bar sbyor ba de ni; de'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi rgyu'i sems nye bar sbyor ba de ni; de'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: its accomplishment.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ltar na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na / byang chub sems dpa' sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom pa'o //
translated: in this way🔽the bodhisattva meditates on the application of mindfulness that observes the mind by observing the mind.

original: de sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na mngon par shes pa thob pa'i phyir sems shin tu 'brel par byed de /
analyzed: de sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na mngon par shes pa thob pa'i phyir sems shin tu 'brel par byed de /
translated: When he observes the mind, he connects the mind with the superknowledges.

original: de mngon par shes pa thob nas sems gcig gis sems can thams cad kyi sems rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de mngon par shes pa thob nas sems gcig gis sems can thams cad kyi sems rab tu shes te /
translated: Having attained the superknowledges, he knows the minds of all beings with a single mind.

original: shes nas kyang de'i rang bzhin gyi chos 'chad do //
analyzed: shes nas kyang de'i rang bzhin gyi chos 'chad do //
translated: Having known them, he teaches the Dharma that is their nature.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na snying rje chen po thob pa'i phyir sems nye bar @340a *//🔽'brel par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na snying rje chen po thob pa'i phyir sems nye bar @340a *// 'brel par byed de /
translated: Moreover, when the bodhisattva dwells in the observation of the mind, he generates the mind in order to attain great compassion.

original: snying rje chen po thob pas sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba la yongs su mi skyo ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po thob pas sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba la yongs su mi skyo ba'o //
translated: Having attained great compassion, he does not become weary of bringing all sentient beings to maturity.

original: sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na sems zad pa dang / sems 'gag par bya ba'i phyir sems gnas par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na sems zad pa dang / sems 'gag par bya ba'i phyir sems gnas par mi byed kyi /
translated: When he dwells in the observation of the mind, he does not generate the mind in order to exhaust the mind or to stop the mind.

original: 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi kun tu sbyor ba rnams kyi sems mngon par sgrub ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi kun tu sbyor ba rnams kyi sems mngon par sgrub ste /
translated: He generates the mind in order to eliminate the fetters of the continuity of cyclic existence.

original: sems kyi dran pa shes pa de ma skyes pa dang / mi skye ba nges par gyur pa la zhugs pa'i chos rnams kyis gnas te /
analyzed: sems kyi dran pa shes pa de ma skyes pa dang / mi skye ba nges par gyur pa la zhugs pa'i chos rnams kyis gnas te /
translated: He dwells in the knowledge of the mindfulness of the mind, which is the entry into the certainty of the non-arising and non-production of all dharmas.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yang mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yang mi ltung ngo //
translated: He does not fall into the stages of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur gyi bar du sems kyi rgyud de rgyun chags par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur gyi bar du sems kyi rgyud de rgyun chags par byed do //
translated: until all the qualities of the Buddha are perfected.

original: sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: In a single instant of wisdom, he attains the highest, complete enlightenment.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: in this way

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom mo //
translated: the bodhisattva practices the application of mindfulness that observes the mind.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: how does

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom pa yin zhe na /
translated: the bodhisattva practice the application of mindfulness that observes phenomena?

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpas 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis chos gang mthong ba de dag byang chub kyi snying po'i bar du bar ma dor rmongs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpas 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis chos gang mthong ba de dag byang chub kyi snying po'i bar du bar ma dor rmongs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: here the bodhisattva, with the eye of noble wisdom, sees phenomena. Until he reaches the seat of awakening, he will not be confused about them.

original: de chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing @340b gnas pa na gang stong pa nyid du ma gtogs pa dang / mtshan ma med par ma gtogs pa dang / smon pa med par ma gtogs pa dang / mi skye bar ma gtogs pa dang /
analyzed: de chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing @340b gnas pa na gang stong pa nyid du ma gtogs pa dang / mtshan ma med par ma gtogs pa dang / smon pa med par ma gtogs pa dang / mi skye bar ma gtogs pa dang /
translated: When they abide observing phenomena in accordance with phenomena, they do not observe anything that is not included in emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-arising, non-birth, non-production, and non-cessation.🔽

original: ma skyes par ma gtogs pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed par ma gtogs pa dang / dngos po med par ma gtogs pa'i chos rdul tsam yang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: ma skyes par ma gtogs pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed par ma gtogs pa dang / dngos po med par ma gtogs pa'i chos rdul tsam yang mi mthong ngo //
translated: When they abide in the observation of phenomena, they do not see even a particle of phenomena that is not included in emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-arising,🔽non-production, non-conditioning, and non-entityness.

original: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar ma gtogs pa'i chos rdul tsam yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar ma gtogs pa'i chos rdul tsam yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see even a particle of phenomena that is not included in dependent origination.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na chos nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong gi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na chos nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong gi /
translated: When bodhisattvas abide in the observation of phenomena, they see the nature of phenomena.

original: chos ma yin pa mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see anything that is not a phenomenon.

original: de la chos gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos gang zhe na /
translated: What is a phenomenon?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bdag med pa'i don dang / sems can med pa'i don dang / srog med pa'i don dang / gang zag med pa'i don te /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i don dang / sems can med pa'i don dang / srog med pa'i don dang / gang zag med pa'i don te /
translated: the meaning of selflessness, the meaning of the absence of sentient beings, the meaning of the absence of life-force, and the meaning of the absence of persons.

original: de ni / chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / chos zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the Dharma.

original: de la chos ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is non-Dharma?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bdag tu lta ba dang / sems can du lta ba dang / srog tu lta ba dang / gang zag tu lta ba dang / chad par lta ba dang / rtag par lta ba dang / 'byung bar lta ba dang / 'jig par lta ba ste /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang / sems can du lta ba dang / srog tu lta ba dang / gang zag tu lta ba dang / chad par lta ba dang / rtag par lta ba dang / 'byung bar lta ba dang / 'jig par lta ba ste /
translated: the view of self, the view of sentient beings, the view of life-force, the view of person, the view of annihilation, the view of permanence, the view of origination, and the view of destruction.

original: de ni / chos ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / chos ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called non-Dharma.

original: yang sh'a ri'i bu /🔽chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: yang sh'a ri'i bu / chos thams cad ni /
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra,🔽all phenomena

original: chos so // chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos so // chos thams cad ni /
translated: are the Dharma, and all phenomena

original: chos ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'o //
translated: are non-Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa shes pa'i phyir chos thams cad chos so //🔽bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i bag la nyal @341a *//
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa shes pa'i phyir chos thams cad chos so // bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i bag la nyal @341a *//
translated: Because of knowing emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, all phenomena are the Dharma.

original: ba'i phyir chos thams cad chos ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i phyir chos thams cad chos ma yin pa'o //
translated: Because of the latent tendencies of the views of self and mine, all phenomena are non-Dharma.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na chos de dag la gang yang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma yin pa gang las byang chub tu mi 'gyur ba dang / gang las sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na chos de dag la gang yang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma yin pa gang las byang chub tu mi 'gyur ba dang / gang las sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: that does not lead to buddhahood,🔽that does not lead to the path,🔽that does not lead to liberation,

original: gang las lam du mi 'gyur ba dang / gang las thar par mi 'gyur ba dang / gang las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'i chos rdul tsam yang mi mthong ste /
analyzed: gang las lam du mi 'gyur ba dang / gang las thar par mi 'gyur ba dang / gang las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'i chos rdul tsam yang mi mthong ste /
translated: or that does not lead to freedom.

original: de chos thams cad 'byung bar shes nas sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba'i snying rje chen po 'thob ste /
analyzed: de chos thams cad 'byung bar shes nas sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba'i snying rje chen po 'thob ste /
translated: Knowing that all phenomena lead to freedom, they attain the great compassion called ‘unobstructed.’

original: sems can thams cad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa la'ang de dag nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa la'ang de dag nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: They think, ‘The afflictions of all beings are not their afflictions.

original: de dag nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: They are without afflictions.🔽’

original: zhes bcos mar 'du shes bskyed do; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bcos mar 'du shes bskyed do; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar de dag ni /
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni /
translated: Because they are like this:

original: nges pa'i don la yang dag par 'jug pa ste /🔽nyon mongs pa rnams la bsags pa'am /
analyzed: nges pa'i don la yang dag par 'jug pa ste / nyon mongs pa rnams la bsags pa'am /
translated: and enters into the definitive meaning.🔽There is no accumulation or

original: phung po'i dngos po med de /
analyzed: phung po'i dngos po med de /
translated: mass of afflictions,

original: de dag nyid rjes su rtogs pa'i phyir byang chub bo //🔽nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa byang chub kyi rang bzhin yang de yin no //
analyzed: de dag nyid rjes su rtogs pa'i phyir byang chub bo // nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa byang chub kyi rang bzhin yang de yin no //
translated: because they are realized as suchness.🔽The nature of the afflictions is the nature of awakening.

original: byang chub kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yang de yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yang de yin te /
translated: The nature of awakening is the nature of the afflictions.

original: de ltar dran pa nye bar gzhog kyang cung zad kyang nye bar 'jog pa med /
analyzed: de ltar dran pa nye bar gzhog kyang cung zad kyang nye bar 'jog pa med /
translated: Thus, although one is engaged in the close placement of mindfulness, nothing is placed,

original: rab tu 'jog ba med /
analyzed: rab tu 'jog ba med /
translated: nothing is placed in a close way,

original: mi 'jog pa med de /
analyzed: mi 'jog pa med de /
translated: and nothing is not placed.

original: chos nyid de gnas pa nyid du @341b rab tu shes so //
analyzed: chos nyid de gnas pa nyid du @341b rab tu shes so //
translated: One understands that suchness is the very state of being present.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: chos kyi dbyings de ni /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de ni /
translated: that basic field of phenomena

original: gnas pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: is called “the very state of being present.”

original: chos kyi dbyings gnas gang la gnas pa sems can gyi khams kyang gnas de la gnas so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings gnas gang la gnas pa sems can gyi khams kyang gnas de la gnas so //
translated: The realm of sentient beings, which is present in the basic field of phenomena, is also present in that very state.

original: sems can gyi khams gnas gang la gnas pa nam mkha'i khams kyang gnas de la gnas te /🔽de bas na /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams gnas gang la gnas pa nam mkha'i khams kyang gnas de la gnas te / de bas na /
translated: The realm of sentient beings is located in space.

original: chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that all phenomena are like space.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na sangs rgyas kyi chos la rton pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na sangs rgyas kyi chos la rton pa yin /
translated: When bodhisattvas observe phenomena in this way, they rely on the qualities of the buddhas.

original: chos thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos su mos par byed de /
analyzed: chos thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos su mos par byed de /
translated: They aspire to all phenomena being the qualities of the buddhas.

original: de zad pa shes pa yang bskyed mod kyi /
analyzed: de zad pa shes pa yang bskyed mod kyi /
translated: Although they develop the knowledge of exhaustion,

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i zad pa yang mngon du mi byed /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i zad pa yang mngon du mi byed /
translated: they do not actualize the exhaustion of conditioned things.

original: mi skye ba shes pa yang mngon par sgrub mod kyi /
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa yang mngon par sgrub mod kyi /
translated: Although they accomplish the knowledge of the unborn,

original: sems can la blta ba'i phyir yang skye la /
analyzed: sems can la blta ba'i phyir yang skye la /
translated: they are born in order to look after sentient beings.

original: mi skye ba'i mtha' de yang mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i mtha' de yang mi gtong ngo //
translated: And they do not abandon the limit of the unborn.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called applications of mindfulness

original: chos thams cad dang dran pa de la gzhog par byed cing /
analyzed: chos thams cad dang dran pa de la gzhog par byed cing /
translated: are the placement of all phenomena and mindfulness in that.

original: nyan thos sam /
analyzed: nyan thos sam /
translated: They are not the śrāvakas’

original: rang sangs rgyas sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas sam /
translated: or the pratyekabuddhas’

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ji snyed chos su gdags pa de dag thams cad ma lus par dran pa de la 'jog ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ji snyed chos su gdags pa de dag thams cad ma lus par dran pa de la 'jog ste /
translated: He places all the qualities of the Buddha, all that is designated as the Dharma, without exception, in his memory.

original: dran pa de yang brjed par mi byed /
analyzed: dran pa de yang brjed par mi byed /
translated: He does not forget that memory.

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du rmongs par mi byed do //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du rmongs par mi byed do //
translated: He does not become confused about it until the end of time.

original: chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o // zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: This is the close placement of mindfulness that observes phenomena in phenomena.”

original: bstan pa dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching that is beyond measure.

original: kun tu spyod yul ma yin pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la yang dag par 'dul ba /🔽sems can thams cad kyi @342a *//
analyzed: kun tu spyod yul ma yin pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la yang dag par 'dul ba / sems can thams cad kyi @342a *//
translated: It is the complete training in all the qualities of the Buddha, which are not the domain of ordinary beings.

original: sems tshim par byed pa /
analyzed: sems tshim par byed pa /
translated: It satisfies the minds of all sentient beings.

original: bdud thams cad 'dul ba rang byung ba rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdud thams cad 'dul ba rang byung ba rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is the self-arisen realization that tames all māras.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: in this way

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom mo //
translated: the bodhisattvas meditate on the close placement of mindfulness that observes phenomena in phenomena.

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: These are called

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi zhes bya ste /
translated: the four close placements of mindfulness.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: in this way

original: byang chub sems dpa' dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po de dag la mkhas pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po de dag la mkhas pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: Bodhisattvas who are skilled in these four establishments of mindfulness practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub kyi yan lag la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub kyi yan lag la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ skill in the branches of awakening?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub kyi yan lag 'di bdun te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub kyi yan lag 'di bdun te /
translated: Bodhisattvas have seven branches of awakening.

original: bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:🔽the mindfulness branch of awakening,🔽the investigation of phenomena branch of awakening,🔽the diligence branch of awakening,🔽the joy branch of awakening,

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
translated: the pliancy branch of awakening,🔽the concentration branch of awakening,

original: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
translated: and the equanimity branch of awakening.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: these are

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub kyi yan lag bdun no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub kyi yan lag bdun no //
translated: The seven factors of enlightenment of the bodhisattvas.

original: de la dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the factor of perfect mindfulness of enlightenment?

original: dran pa gang gis chos rtogs par byed /🔽chos la so sor rtog par byed /
analyzed: dran pa gang gis chos rtogs par byed / chos la so sor rtog par byed /
translated: It is the mindfulness by which one understands the Dharma,🔽examines the Dharma,

original: chos la dpyod par byed /
analyzed: chos la dpyod par byed /
translated: investigates the Dharma,

original: 'chos yongs su tshol @342b bar byed cing chos rnam par 'byed par byed pa dang / chos la rnam par rtog par byed de /
analyzed: 'chos yongs su tshol @342b bar byed cing chos rnam par 'byed par byed pa dang / chos la rnam par rtog par byed de /
translated: seeks the Dharma, discerns the Dharma, and reflects on the Dharma.

original: de dran pa des gang chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid de yang rjes su rtogs so //
analyzed: de dran pa des gang chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid de yang rjes su rtogs so //
translated: By this mindfulness one understands the essential nature of the Dharma.

original: yang chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of the essential nature of the Dharma?

original: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa ste /🔽gang de ltar dran zhing khong chud pa de ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa ste / gang de ltar dran zhing khong chud pa de ni /
translated: It is the emptiness of all dharmas by reason of their own marks.

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: That mindfulness by which one understands and penetrates this is called the factor of perfect mindfulness of enlightenment.

original: de la chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the factor of complete discernment of phenomena that is a factor of awakening?

original: gang chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong rab tu rnam par 'byed pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: gang chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong rab tu rnam par 'byed pa shes pa ste /
translated: It is the knowledge that completely discerns the eighty-four thousand aggregates of phenomena.

original: nges pa'i don kyang nges pa'i don du /🔽drang ba'i don kyang drang ba'i don du /🔽kun rdzob kyi don kyang kun rdzob kyi don du /
analyzed: nges pa'i don kyang nges pa'i don du / drang ba'i don kyang drang ba'i don du / kun rdzob kyi don kyang kun rdzob kyi don du /
translated: The definitive meaning is known as the definitive meaning.🔽The interpretable meaning is known as the interpretable meaning.🔽The conventional meaning is known as the conventional meaning.

original: don dam pa'i don kyang don dam pa'i don du /
analyzed: don dam pa'i don kyang don dam pa'i don du /
translated: The ultimate meaning is known as the ultimate meaning.

original: brda yang brdar /
analyzed: brda yang brdar /
translated: Symbols are known as symbols.🔽The definitive is known as the definitive.

original: rnam par gtan la bab pa yang rnam par gtan la bab par chos de dag ji ltar rab tu dbye bar bya ba de bzhin du de dag rnam par 'byed par byed de /
analyzed: rnam par gtan la bab pa yang rnam par gtan la bab par chos de dag ji ltar rab tu dbye bar bya ba de bzhin du de dag rnam par 'byed par byed de /
translated: Those phenomena are completely discerned just as they are to be discerned.

original: de ni / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the factor of complete discernment of phenomena that is a factor of awakening.

original: de la brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the factor of enthusiastic perseverance that is a factor of awakening?

original: gang chos rnam par 'byed pa de nyid kyi dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms dang / ye shes kyi bar du 'dzin pa dang / spro ba dang / stobs dang / rtul ba dang / mi ldog pa'i mos pa dang /
analyzed: gang chos rnam par 'byed pa de nyid kyi dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms dang / ye shes kyi bar du 'dzin pa dang / spro ba dang / stobs dang / rtul ba dang / mi ldog pa'i mos pa dang /
translated: It is the delight in discerning phenomena, and it is the retention of pliancy, samādhi, equanimity, and wisdom. It is enthusiasm, strength, perseverance, and irreversible interest.

original: mthu dang / brtson pa mi 'dor ba dang / lam mngon par rtogs @343a *//🔽par bya ba la brtson 'grus rtsom pa ste /
analyzed: mthu dang / brtson pa mi 'dor ba dang / lam mngon par rtogs @343a *// par bya ba la brtson 'grus rtsom pa ste /
translated: It is power, not abandoning effort, and striving to realize the path.

original: de ni / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the factor of awakening that is right effort.

original: de la dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the factor of awakening that is delight?

original: dga' ba gang dang / chos la dga' ba gang dang / chos la mchog tu dga' ba gang gis sems mi zhum zhing dang ba ste /
analyzed: dga' ba gang dang / chos la dga' ba gang dang / chos la mchog tu dga' ba gang gis sems mi zhum zhing dang ba ste /
translated: It is the delight, the joy in the Dharma, and the supreme joy in the Dharma that cause the mind to be undepressed and clear.

original: ma zhum pa'i dga' ba des gang lus sam; sems kyang shin tu byang bar byed la /
analyzed: ma zhum pa'i dga' ba des gang lus sam; sems kyang shin tu byang bar byed la /
translated: With that undepressed delight, the body and mind become very pliable.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa yang sel ba de ni /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa yang sel ba de ni /
translated: It is the removal of affliction.

original: dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the limb of enlightenment of joy.

original: de la shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the limb of enlightenment of pliancy?

original: gang lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sgrib pa med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin du dmigs pa la sems nye bar gzhog pa ste /
analyzed: gang lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sgrib pa med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin du dmigs pa la sems nye bar gzhog pa ste /
translated: It is the pliancy of the body, the pliancy of the mind, the pliancy of the afflictions, the absence of obscurations, and the settling of the mind in samādhi.

original: de ni / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the limb of enlightenment of pliancy.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the limb of enlightenment of samādhi?

original: gang sems mnyam par bzhag pas chos shes pa rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang sems mnyam par bzhag pas chos shes pa rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: It is the knowledge of phenomena that is realized through the mind being in equipoise.

original: sems mnyam par ma bzhag pas ni /
analyzed: sems mnyam par ma bzhag pas ni /
translated: It is not realized through the mind not being in equipoise.

original: ma yin pa dang / sems mnyam par gzhag pas chos de dag mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'i /
analyzed: ma yin pa dang / sems mnyam par gzhag pas chos de dag mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'i /
translated: It is the phenomena that are fully awakened to through the mind being in equipoise.

original: sems mnyam par ma gzhag bsam yin te /
analyzed: sems mnyam par ma gzhag bsam yin te /
translated: It is not realized through the mind not being in equipoise.🔽“

original: chos mnyam pa nyid dang / chos la gzhol ba ma gtogs par rjes su chags pa'i kun @343b nas dkris pas rtogs par mi byed de /
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid dang / chos la gzhol ba ma gtogs par rjes su chags pa'i kun @343b nas dkris pas rtogs par mi byed de /
translated: They do not understand it through the fetter of attachment, except through the sameness of phenomena and the inclination towards phenomena.

original: de ni / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the branch of enlightenment of meditative absorption.

original: de la btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /🔽gang yid bde ba dang / gang yid mi bde ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sems mi 'dzin pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi 'phrog pa dang / mthon dman du mi gnas pa'i phyir rab tu mi g-yo /🔽mi 'khrug / rab tu mi 'khrug /
analyzed: de la btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na / gang yid bde ba dang / gang yid mi bde ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sems mi 'dzin pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi 'phrog pa dang / mthon dman du mi gnas pa'i phyir rab tu mi g-yo / mi 'khrug / rab tu mi 'khrug /
translated: “What is the branch of enlightenment of equanimity?

original: yang dag par mi 'khrug /🔽chags par mi byed /
analyzed: yang dag par mi 'khrug / chags par mi byed /
translated: It is the mind that does not grasp at the aspects of things that are favorable or unfavorable, that is not carried away by worldly things, that is not agitated, that is not disturbed, that is not completely disturbed, that is not attached,

original: zhe sdang bar mi byed kyi /
analyzed: zhe sdang bar mi byed kyi /
translated: that is not averse,

original: 'phags pa'i lam de nyid dang mthun par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam de nyid dang mthun par byed pa ste /

translated: It is the path of cultivation that is in accord with wisdom.🔽It is the knowledge that sees phenomena as devoid of movement, devoid of sentient beings, devoid of life-force, devoid of person, and devoid of individual. original: skye mched rnams la grong stong par mthong ba'i shes pa dang / mig la rab tu rnam par phye ba mthong ba'i shes pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mi 'gal bar mthong ba'i shes pa dang / sems can du lta ba dang bral bar mthong ba'i shes pa dang /

translated: It is the knowledge that sees the āyatanas as an empty town, and the eyes as fully dissected. It is the knowledge that sees dependent origination as noncontradictory, and the view of sentient beings as free from separation.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par smin pa mthong ba'i shes pa dang / 'bras bu thob pa mngon sum du bya ba mthong ba'i shes pa dang / yang dag pa nyid du 'jug pa la 'jug par byed pa mthong ba'i shes pa'o //🔽yang lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni /

translated: the cognition of seeing the ripening of causes and effects, the cognition of seeing the attainment of the result, and the cognition of seeing the entry into correct engagement.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: chos rnams ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba dang / chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid mthong ba dang / chos rnams kyi gzhan ma yin pa nyid mthong ba dang / chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid mthong ba dang / mtshan ma med pa mthong ba dang /
